Interesting class and a generally interested teacher are a good thing to have. Things were explained, discussion in class was made, and the teacher listened to everyone.

His knowledge of the material and fluidness with its recitation will go unmatched by any graduate student I will ever meet.  He will make a wonderful professor one day.  Professional, humorous, but not for every one.  Can be tough, but worth a shot for any ambitious Ohio State student.
extremely helpful, very interesting lectures and the content is stimulating. he will be a great professor someday. i highly recommend this class if you need a GEC. plus he is very attractive
Great teacher...approachable, friendly, and explains all material very well
Not enough class discussions and clarity is tough because of his teaching style

What an excellent professor! Dai's intimate knowledge of the subject allows for verbal jousting thoroughly injected with humor and realism. Philosophy is considered inherently impenetrable, arduous and incomprehensibly verbose.. Dai possesses an innate succinctness that cuts through the layers of frustration experienced by many students.

His class is challenging, but not unfairly so. He is willing to spend time helping you if you ask. He also did a nice job keeping his own opinion out of it, it was hard to tell what he actually agreed with because he represented different views fairly. Nice guy.
Hard grader, gave a low score on an important paper and never gave no reason why.  Never responded to any e-mails.

This was probably one of the most difficult profs I have ever had. He would ask you to state your opinion clearly in a paper, only to shoot it down and continuously criticize... there is no pleasing him...

i have no idea where anyone is coming from with all the talk of him being biased. i was surprised by how unbiased he was.  class is not mandatory but it really helps with the papers. i kind of even enjoyed the class.  just lecturing and discussions the whole time and the material is interesting.  plus he's a great guy and not bad to look at either.
Overall a very good prof... Class was very rough though. He was very funny.

The reading material and discussion of it are interesting.  I think the class could have stood to have a little change in pace.  It was very nice not being obligated to attend every class or to participate.  Update:  I'm not sure why I gave this a 4 easiness.  He is a pretty tough grader.
Very unhelpful, arrogant, completely biased.
Dai is a good guy and the class is mildly interesting but AVOID!!!!! the papers are really really hard unless you are a philosophy major.

Class was completely one sided.  The class should be social and moral issues from the extreme left.  On top of that, if you are not very liberal in your stands you probably won't do well in this class as the teacher doesn't really respect or have time for your viewpoints.  If you have the opportunity to take this class, I'd say pass on it

Interesting class, but I do agree with other reviewers that he does grade kind of hard for a 367. 4-5 papers are all the grades, discussion format (prbly 50-75% his lecture/presentation, tho).  Regular attendance will help your grade a lot.  Recommend if you're willing to go most days + do readings regularly, and are a decent writer

I only took this course cause I forgot my registration window and it was the only GEC open. MISTAKE. This class is very annoying. He talks in a fake deep voice, the classes go on forever, papers are graded very harshly. I want to fight this guy. Philosophy sucks, this class sucks, he sucks, avoid.

knows his stuff but the papers are really hard to write unless you know alot about philosophy. i think his grading is unfair because he does not take into account that some people in the class already took philosophy and some havent. interestin material but the papers suck. good TA, bad class. avoid

Presents great article on very controversial issues.  He takes the time to show all sides of issues and helps you understand what the writers are getting at.  Doesn't make class mandatory and is very laid back. Highly recommend taking this course as him as your teacher.
Loves to hear himself talk without being informative.
Nice guy and actually lectured a class for us, did a great job
No Comments
Very helpful.Fair grader.
Helpful, and he DOES NOT grade on whether you go along with his view or not, you just have to support your view. Sometimes a little harsh on students, but a good ta overall, and very cool.

Definitely knows the material, but not clear when trying to convey info to students. Does not like when you go against his personal point of view and your grade will reflect this. Isn't that the point of philosophy, to take opposing views? As Philosophers havn't they made careers of just that? Avoid
very good TA, did so much more than he was required to to make the class easier on the students. better than the other ta especially
No Comments

The lectures were long but it's not anything worse than you would expect from an ethics course. Danny has a monotone voice, but he's a cool guy.  A lot of readings were assigned at the beginning but not at the end of the semester. Grading is fair.  A few pop quizzes. I recommend him; you'll get a fair grade. btw, no textbook!

Danny was a great teacher.  Even though he may drag on and on about subjects, the class is easy and he's happy to help.  Class is kind of boring, but it's what you make of it. Attendance isn't mandatory but going to class is the only way of turning in homework, so i guess it is kind of necessary to attend class.
So boring. I dread going to this class all day long. Danny's class is so incredibly dull and he doesn't let you use your laptop. I really would not recommend this class to anybody.

I'm generally interested in philosophy so I was looking forward to taking this class, but I changed my mind within the first week. Class was extremely boring and the teacher had a knack for drawing out and overcomplicating simple ideas. Avoid if possible.

Very helpful. Returned my emails and had extra office hours to help me. I agree that the subject is flat out boring- that's not his fault. Seems like a nice guy. I didn't have a problem asking him for help- he wasn't mean about it.
Easily the most boring professor I have ever met. At least attendance wasn't required.

I didn't know a little man with a cut off t-shirt and a tattoo of a philosopher on his arm could be so boring. Everything is over complicated and could be taught in a much simpler manner. Sometimes it felt like he was intentionally trying to make his examples boring, which in my opinion is a terrible teaching tactic.
Nice teacher, boring topic (not his fault). Easy grader. Really does love cats a lot...

Probably one of the most boring, monotone people I've ever met. The class is supposed to be logic but really all you need to do i memorize the notes because there is no critical thinking involved. Obsessive about his diagrams. And Boring. I cannot say that enough.

Really chill dude, he seems to know his material. He is pretty funny, but in an awkward way, so it's more like we're laughing at him. He loves cats. The class was pretty easy so long as you come everyday. He gave a few bonus points on random days.
definitely take his class. its very interesting and extremely easy. one of the most helpful professors. also is very good at answering emails fast. is also super lenient.
good prof. heard other 101s are more boring than this one.

Only problem was that class was at 7:30am. Lets u have a cheat sheet for exam. Answers emails fast. Give lots of quizes (all open book). Short written responses (easy). Very helpful prof- really seems like he cares about students learning.
This class was interesting and pretty easy if you go to class everyday and take notes. Teacher is very approachable and was very helpful.

Matt was a great lecturer for Asian Philosophy! He always tried to explain the material as thoroughly as possible, and encouraged discussions and reflection on the material. He is a young guy and very open about his knowledge, and he isn't arrogant or condescending like he probably could be. Overall great class, very interesting, and recommended.

Asian Philosophy was possibly the most stimulating and fulfilling class I took this semester, but I already had interest in the subject. The class is relatively easy, but lectures are really important. There wasn't enough discussion for a philosophy class in my opinion, but it makes sense cause it was a huge lecture. Book is useful for extra cred

Matt's TAs grade the papers and the majority of exams. You need to go to his lectures to get the notes, but if you memorize them like the back of your hand you'll be all set for the tests. He explains concepts very thoroughly and gives great examples to help you understand. A+ professor. Also, read the textbook if you want extra credit points.

Talk in class everyday, go to office hours and read the readings and you will get an A. Attendance is mandatory and you must participate, this is 40% of your grade.  participation is 40% of your grade. She will try to make herself seem like the most reasonable person, but won't always go through with things. She truly does care about her students.

I found her teaching style to be weird. I didn't like her approach. There were some things that didn't jive well with me and I made mention of them.  Overall, the class is interesting and enlightening. This was just a clash of personalities. In more than one situation, I felt singled out and brought this to her attn.

Professor Novakowski may come off as tough at first, but once you go to her office hours, and actually see that she cares a lot about her students the class becomes a lot easier! Make sure you participate, ask questions, do the readings and if you don't agree with your grade, talk to her! (she will give you extra points no matter what)

Make sure you are willing to go to class. Participation is atleast 10% of grade. Only wrote 4 papers, but the last one was worth 55%. She doesn't grade too hard and tries to be interesting, but if you don't like philosophy you probably shouldn't try this as your writing class.

Teaches with depth and intelligence. She makes it easy to get a good grade, even if you don't absorb everything from lecture. Came in with no interest in subject but left with a strong appreciation for it.
She's a great teacher but you must attend her class. Might seem dull at times but brave through it and you will be rewarded.
Doesn't get any point across. Completely abstract. Hard to grasp anything she says. Avoid this class.
Really funny, uses great examples, and is very accessible outside of class. Very laid back and to the point.
Tough grader until you realize what he is looking for. Very nice, very compelling lectures! Loved this class, it helped my writing and reading skills a lot

Very difficult grader, but not impossible to get an A. Your creativity and reasoning skills are really going to be pushed even in this basic level class. Juan gives really constructive feedback that will allow you to improve your writing as the semester progresses. You must read his feedback, and read the material & take notes before class. POPQUIZ
One of the smartest profs I've ever had. Really a great guy. Participation in class is crucial, most of lecture is conversation based.
Clear lectures and helpful outside of class in office hours
Only grades are a few papers and participation. He is not the most exciting teacher but not too bad. He. Ever put any grades into Carmen.

Chris shows interest and work in the material and gives good lectures. Sometimes he gets a bit off topic andor rushed but not too bad. Going to his office hours to discuss the material more helped a lot.

It was a pretty challenging class  but he explains the material clearly in lecture.   People sometimes complains that he drones, but you can tell he is very knowledgeable and interested in the material he teaches.  His midterms are very fair but his TAs grade a bit harder than I liked.   Expect to work for a good grade in this class.
This course could have been much more interesting. I am very disappointed and do not recommend this professor, he is very boring and seemed uninterested in teaching

I took her class a year ago during the election year. Lets just say she had some pretty strong biases that were evident in her lectures. Not a difficult class if you can put up with the obvious bias but it really drove myself and others crazy. She dedicated an entire day to talking politics as well which was the worst day I can remember.

Regular weekly online reading quizzes and discussion posts. All of the material was relevant to in class discussions and learning.  Few movie days to break up slides and lectures. Final paper and group project but she leaves you well prepared to do well on the assignments. The class was really relevant and i learned a lot. Caring smart teacher

Show up to class because the discussion is so cool. She is passionate and relevant. You can tell she cares and wants to better the world but shes honest and real. The class had weekly reading quizzes (10 qs) and discussion posts from a video/ted talk but it was all relevant. Course flowed well. She was great to have discussions with. Fast emailer.

HATED this class. Pro. Mason is a cool person, but she was a very harsh grader and unclear. She encourages you to have an opinion of your own, but as soon as you speak up, she knocked you down. Almost making me feel dumb. Eventually I stopped talking. And so did my classmates. Evident by the poor attendance. Avoid this class.

She was an alright teacher, did her best to explain things, but some days she would explain something one way, and the explanation would be the oposite another day. She's pretty demeaning in the way she talks, and you absolutely cannot be right in this class. Her opinion is the only right answer, and yours is always wrong. But overall, she's ok.

This teacher was okay in class but horrendously inconsistent and arbitrary in grading, it seemed no matter what I wrote for her class it was not good enough, I would get her responses for journals like "paragraph too long" and then after that "paragraph too short" and I would get marked points off every time, rediculous...

Patronizing would be the best word for the class. I felt like I was being talked down to the whole time. She generally assumes that she has moral knowledge that us "kids" have never heard of, it's very heavy-handed. Maybe without her soapbox moments it could have been an alright class, but I doubt it, each class was so inconsistent and tedious.

Biais grader. Test are all short answer questions where she docks mad points for minimal differences in her "model answer". She wont tell you why she counted off either. Boring class. She gives at least 30 points of extra credit and you will still struggle to get a B in the class. Good luck!
She was an interesting, nice teacher that took the time and effort to help you if you didn't  understand the material. I would recommend her.

Overall her teaching is rather "meh." There were  some good moments, but far and few between. The class was inconsistent, dull, and unnecessarily didactic, which showed in the poor attendance. As a former teacher, I can say Mason needs more development in dealing larger class dynamics.

Should've dropped this class right away when she forbade laptops in class. I take notes exclusively via laptop; trying to take paper notes proved frustrating & useless. Between that and her condescending attitude - she claims her class is a safe space but openly says she'll mock students in the syllabus - you won't miss much choosing another prof.

She is a genuinely interesting and nice person, but I do not understand her grading. The quizzes can be difficult, and since they are short it's easy to get a B or C. She graded me harshly for being unspecific on my first paper and then harshly on the second for being too specific. It's hard to know what she wants sometimes.

Ugh I just hated this class. It wasn't so much Lindsey, but I found her very boring but perhaps it was just because I was so uninterested in the material. I'm not an idiot and I went to every class, I'm just not a fan of Philosophy. If you're interested in Philosophy, I'm sure she'd be great. Class got much better through when we got to issues.

She was awesome. She really spiked my interest in the topic. She explained everything very well and always had the right response to all of the idiots in the class. Never read any of the books, just took notes. Got an A in the class

She's very nice as a person. I thought she was fair (for the most part) in grading her assignments. As long as you seek her during office hours, she'll always be willing to help you. Do the homework also

Did an excellent job teaching a difficult subject.  She was confusing at times, but it IS a confusing subject at times and she IS just starting to teach.  She goes out of her way to help students and make sure they succeed in the course.

ok...she is a nice teacher and she is very down to earth....but can someone please explain to me how do you come to class everyday and copying her notes word from word, and STILL fail the class...I don't get...she doesn't even explain why you got a bad grade...I HATED HER CLASS!!!!

Lindsey was really sweet and actually made it worth going to class. You are allowed to miss two days but if you miss at all, its really hard to understand the difficult readings. I didn't read anything (no book required, she puts everything on carmen) and went to class and wrote down her notes word for word, memorized them for tests and got a B+.

I bought the books because he said I would need them and I never opened either all semester. Class is pointless but you still have to go because participation is 10% of the grade. Midterms are easy because he tells you exactly what is on them and the paper he gives you plenty of time. Should have done better but screwed up a midterm. Very easy tho.

This is the best GE teacher I have ever met. He reads from his power points but he also has a lot of discussion, which I think most helpful. I am an international student and he is extremely patient with me. I'm not a person who is easy to get nervous but I did stammer facing him because he is hot!

Pat is fantastic. I am admittedly awful with math and he made stats seem manageable. He's funny and engaging and knows his audience (kids afraid to take regular stats because they think they're bad at math). Take his class!

Pat is very kind and helpful to all his students' comments and questions. He's very approachable and friendly, just come to his office hour anytime. He's funny too and gives all the guidelines for exams. One of the best professors in OSU!

Pat has mastered the art of walking the fine line of teaching students new information while remaining conscious and attentive to those that require a bit of extra TLC.  I found his class incredibly informative and practical.  A must take to fulfill your Data/Analysis GEC.
Very helpful and makes an otherwise boring subject interesting. Quizzes and tests are often straight from homework and are therefore pretty easy.

One of the best instructors and people in general I've met at Ohio State. He's always very interested in answering students' questions. Take advantage of his office hours, he's a really great guy to have one on one conversations with and he knows a lot over a broad range of philosophy.

Very helpful. Always accepting of everyones comments. If you pay attention in class and try to understand the information as he presents it you should be fine. Sometimes the grading is a little harsh.
He was funny and entertaining. Very passionate about philosophy. Make sure you do the readings and study the notes well and you will be fine.

Class at 730am and didn't mind waking up. He made it fun & interesting. Very approachable and helpful. Used examples from pop culture which I think helped people get into the class. Encouraged discussion between students and was accepting of any comment that was said. I would recommend this class and this instructor to anyone!

Patrick is a great prof! This was my ethics class, and he found a way to make the material easier and interesting. Definitely just go to class, pay attention and use the internet notes and study guides and you should be fine.Only complaint is sometimes grades too harshly, but hes willing to work with you.

Despite other comments, I felt he delivered the material with as much ease as is possible with an intro class.  Lots of reading...but it is college (its customary to actually do work here).  Prepares you sufficently for quizzes and exams.  With such a coffee addition, it might help if he discovered the reusable cup... great teacher over all.
Basically a TA on a power trip. He loves to hear himself talk, is no help whatsoever, and is incredibly stuck on himself. Avoid this class, and this teacher.

He makes class very easy by putting notes online and making reviews for the midterm and final - Really nice guy, always responds promptly to emails. He is also a pretty funny guy which definitely helps the almost 2 hour lecture pass pretty quickly.

I had no interest in this class at first, I only took it to get out of taking stats.  However, by the time it was over, I was very interested.  I was surprised at how interesting the class ended up being.  Sometimes he could be a bit confusing, but everything eventually made sense.

Such a hard class, but pat was a great teacher! i dont think he was stuck up at all. just because he knows what he is talking about doesnt make him stuck up. anyways, i did not understand the class at all, but he explains things really well. most difficult class i have taken, but best teacher i have had yet!

His tests were very tricky. The practice questions we did in the book and in class were SO much easier. Not very good at explaining how to do things.. pretty much a horrible teacher with a stuck-up, boring attitude

Pat is the reason I watch strange foreign films, got a starbucks credit card, and started listening to insane techno.  But as far as the class goes, I had no idea break dancing had anything to do with logic.   thanks pat pat pattaaalack -the participants ps-keep rapping; it makes the class so much fun!
What an amazing professor, although the class was hard to follow because I was distracted by his beauty. Sighhh

Not my favorite subject but the class wasn't too bad. Tests were okay but I felt he put tricky questions on there and made exams harder than needed. Overall, not too bad but I wouldn't take another philosophy class. Pat was helpful though.
I think he means well, but he comes across as pompous and it's frustrating.  Seems biased when presenting information.

Pat was a great instructor. I only took Philos 153 to satisfy a GEC requirement, but he did a great job making it bearable. He's also very kind-hearted and very willing to help students who are struggling. Defintely recommended; pretty easy class.
tricky subject but good teacher.  a few silly projects, difficult quizzes.  makes sense in class, but at home, i'm totally lost.  oh, and yes, he IS cute (not that it matters).
Joe knows his stuff.  He was helpful and kept things interesting, even in an 8 a.m. class.  I like his collared shirts.

I thought Sanson was a great teacher. He was passionate about the subjects he taught (I took ancient and medieval with him). Those classes were the first taste I had of metaphysics, and I found all of his drawing really helpful.

David teaches the material very well - sometimes his lectures are confusing but it's not due to his own fault, it's because the subject matter itself is confusing. He is clear about what he wants you to know for exams and papers, he isn't overly demanding and he's a fair grader. I would definitely recommend him.

I'm sure Sanson is quite knowledgeable in the field of Metaphysics, but his lectures are beyond confusing. Nearly the entire class had to rewrite the first essay. If you're willing to voice an opinion, be prepared to be mocked.

I thought he was awesome. As you go through the quarter, he gets better. The material can be tough, especially the readings. But he presents them as clear as any prof could and his class is about as easy as a class could be covering that material.

Not gonna lie, I hated him at first.  As the quarter progressed I liked him more and more though.  He's tough, but so are the concepts.  Lectures could be torturous, but he's pretty up-front about what will be on exams, kinda.

I think he expected too much from an introductory class. The topics were challenging, and his lectures often went on too long. He was always willing to help with papers, though he graded very hard. I didn't enjoy the class, but I really liked him.

Taught the concepts well, but showed up late alot and took a long time to get through things. The tests were also made so that they needed very specific answers and became rather hard compared to what he had taught.
hard as hell almost impossible but subject matter is difficult

Knows material, but has a hard time teaching it to students. A lot of people don't show up to class. If you read the book, then you probably wouldn't have to come. Grades on a huge curve, but tests are rather tough.

I really loved that he had us write drafts prior to a final grade on each paper. I felt like it really helped me learn more that way. A meeting with Ben was also required to discuss the final paper, which I also found very helpful. You will learn a lot from his classes!

He taught Phil 131.01, Engineering ethics...except he forget the engineering ethics part.  Spends far too much time lecturing on philosophy theories, pointless for an engineer to take his class.  Nice guy though, and the end project about an engineering ethics case was great.  Gives pop quizzes and assigns a paper. REALLY BORING LECTURER!
Discussion based classes help students. Humorous, though slightly eccentric professor. As long as you attend lectures, you should be fine on quizzes and exams.

At first, his personality can be a little off-putting, but he definitely grew on me. Lectures are discussion based, which makes the class enjoyable. No surprises on quizzes and tests, just go to every lecture and you will succeed.

this class was really difficult and confusing.  the notes are online, but he doesn't do a good job of explaining the examples.  exams are ridiculous, but they're curved. only reason why i did well in this class.  if you're trying to get out of stats with this class, just take stats.  but he is nice to look at!

so hard to follow. his examples are all over the place and half the time he seems to not know where he's going with what he's saying. nonetheless, attending his class really helped because even though he provided notes, they were hard to understand without him semi-explaining them.
Easy peasy. This guy is very conversational and will explain any problems you have with the work. Great and easy way to get your stats GEC
I could not ask for a better person to present a dry subject like eng'g ethics. He made the class fun.

Good teacher. Cracks jokes now and then. Will treat you well if you demonstrate a little effort. Sometimes goes on talking about something a bit too much, but tries to make discussion and keep things interesting. More of a "sit and listen" class, though. Good teacher. Cracks jokes now and then. Will treat you well if you demonstrate a little effort. Sometimes goes on talking about something a bit too much, but tries to make discussion and keep things interesting. More of a "sit and listen" class, though.
Fuller was a good guy, makes jokes, but as long as you care or act like you care you will do well, just dont bs him
Agreed, could be a 45 minute class if all the "funny" little jokes and such were cut out. If you prefer to be straight up lectured with no "cuteness".. I'd avoid his classes.
He is interested in his students.  However, his lectures are quite incomprehensible.

Can be a bit boring, but he makes things easy with notes handouts and review sessions for the final.  Thought the class was interesting because of the material not so much him, although he is really laid back and casual.

He was laid back but too laid back at times. He tries to be too cool with the students and it got in the way of his teaching sometimes. Exams are the worst! very hard...he tried to be helpful at times....

A two and a half hour class that could be twenty minutes. Incredibly boring. Fuller can be funny but most of the time he plays with his hair and thinks he is hot****...which he isnt. It's not thaaaat bad though i guess.
Timmy is so hot! And he has great teaching methodology as well...
Great Class - Very Cute Guy.  Needless to say, worth the time.
The most casual, and fun class I've ever had!
This class made me switch my major to Philosophy. Amy is a great professor.
This topic was pretty boring, but prof Kouri tried to make it interesting. She is also hot, which helps. Yes, the textbook is british, but she is canadian so its ok

One of the worst professors I have had here at The Ohio State University. She has knowledge on the subject, but she has no idea how to teach. Everyone did terrible on the Midterm and Everyone said they thought they did terrible on the Final. She used a British book, and used examples for arguments that werent true. DO NOT ADVISE TAKING THIS CLASS
The best prof i've ever seen in the entire universe.
Most laid back prof I've ever seen. His summer class consisted of 2 Midterms and 1 writing assignment. No final exam. Lots of readings and class discussions. All around nice guy.
Super laid back and cool. No textbook. Very interested in the material he is teaching.
Great Pofessor. Lectures and notes are helpful and interesting. He gives you typed notes. Exams are pretty easy and from his notes.He respects students' point of view. Easy going professor.
Great teacher. Good notes. No textbook. Just be able to formulate a good opinion.
Fantastic Teacher. No Textbook

Robby was a great teacher.  I found that he was fair in grading.  He did cancel class at times, but I don't feel that those classes would have helped any.  The topics were somewhat confusing and i think overall he did a great job explaining it and going over explanations of the theories and arguments.

Robby's lectures were were jumbled and he cancelled class a lot. He also doesn't respond to student emails and is very hard to get a hold. The classes were based around arguments that he chose and he practically encourages students not to attend.

Robby was the TA. He is a tough but fair grader- he wasn't going to give points if you didnt earn them (though he got easier as the class went on). Always willing to help, but isnt always clear in explaining things-could use more examples. He  will definitely improve as he continues teaching. Recommend if you are willing to do the assigned work.
best professor ive had at osu. makes class interesting and fun. i had no interest in asian philosophy and he made me want to go to every class. got an A. take this class with nick hes amazing

This is one of the most interesting classes ive taken since ive been in college.  He tells you what is going to be on the test so if you study it you will get an easy A.  you will want to go to class because the material is so interesting! I LOVED this class :) take it!

Very good class and instructor.  Tests aren't easy but they are manageable if you've been to all the classes.  I didn't buy any of the books and did just fine.  He covers everything necessary in class.

Uses his clever wit and sense of humor to make class interesting and informative. He doesn't take attendance, but makes you WANT to show up for class anyway. I took this class several quarters ago and thanks to him I not only can remember everything I learned but also have ways to apply it to real life. He is easily one of my heroes.

A really funny, clever professor. The class was enlightening and interesting, and it was made more so by the listenable teaching style of Prof. Jones. He told jokes that didn't make sense at all, but were hilarious all the same.

Loves what he teaches, friendly, and helpful. Gives some extra credit on tests, the vocabulary part is tricky. Started to use powerpoint presentations, makes the class interesting, tells funny jokes, and gives review and heads up on short essays questions on midterms and final. Highly recommended.

i want to be a philosophy instructor/lecturer/professor someday and this guy is my idol.  does everything the way it should be done in a good and effective class.  i hope i'm that good someday and i also hope that barely legal girls still think i'm hot when i'm 30!!!

Nick probably my favorite professor so far. He's super cute and charming...lol yes I have a bit of a crush. But aside from that he is a great teacher. Oranized lots of extra credit. If you go to class and actively listen you will get a decent grade.
Nick Jones... WHO?  Nick Jones... WHO?   Yeah he rocked.  One of the best teachers I've ever had.  Makes an already interesting class far more interesting.

Nick has been one of my favorite professors at OSU.  The course material is challenging, but he is as helpful as humanly possible and keeps things stress-free.  Go to class and there is no need to buy the book.  Lots of extra credit, too.  I got an A.  I almost want to change my major now so I can be witty and intellectual for a living.
love the class. changed a lot of things for me about thinking. awesome teacher. cute and fun and interesting. like this class and the prof. alot! take it!

He tells random jokes that aren't funny and riddles that make no since. I guess that's a part of his appeal. I liked him. The assignments were easy (3 papers and some reading summaries for a second-writing course). The only downfall of the class was the students. The class was one-sided on most issues. And no one wanted to talk at 830am.
He is the best!  I love him!

he's so cute.  i just want to hug him.  i want him to be my friend.  he's a good teacher too, he has his little quirks while explaining things that if you fall asleep you will miss.  i don't think he likes monkeys tho

Step right up for an intelligent, concise lecturer who isn't too tough on the eyes.  If you go for brainy nerdboy cute, this is YOUR man.  Sure, he knocks vegetarians and New York all the time in his example, and uses football references that I don't understand, but it's okay, because he is Nick Jones. <3

Nick is very interested in teaching and making sure you understand what he wants you to write about.  The topics are interesting and the debates are well structured.  Readings a little boring and hard to understand but he is not strict on summary grading.  Extremely Recommended.
I found some of the material hard to swallow-- but not the instructor.  He ****s logic like his name is Dolemite.
He had a lot of insightful things to say about the material, but it's very difficult to listen to when you can't stop undressing him with your eyes... Nick Jones has the ass that just woun't quit!

He made what could have been a difficult class a lot easier. He allowed us to choose what our final exam would be (a paper or multiple choice exam etc.) He was pretty funny and I would definitly take another class of his.
Now that I have taken more philosophy classes, it's worth saying how much clearer and easier to learn from this guy is than others in the dept. I'd definitely recommend him for GEC classes.

Miller tried to act tough the first few weeks of the semester, but he's really a good teacher and a nice guy.  He makes the material surprisingly clear and has a nerdy sort of humor.  There's really no reason to do poorly in his class; grades only come from 3 tests, but his study guides are helpful and he gives a bonus question on each.  Recommend!

Great instructor. Extremely knowledgeable about his subject, and GREAT at explaining it. Crystal clear on expectations, and very friendly and helpful. Takes attendance through daily reading quizzes, and three exams. All easy if you read and focus on what he tells you to. There's really no reason not to do well in this class. Highly recommended.

easy second writing course. miller assigns two 5-10 page reading assignments for each class and the entire class period is spent talking about the philosophical opinions expressed by the author. no exams; 3 papers.  attendance is required: one-question quiz taken at beginning of every class for attendance and reading check.
He was so respectful of everyone's opinions. Funny and cute, too.

Very hard class. He doesn't make it easy with the 150 or so vocab. words he wants you to remember. Lectures are boring, just notes notes notes. Beware only 3 tests given, no time to make your grade up if you have failed the first test. He isn't willing to bend anything either. Wouldn't suggest him at all. The worst Philosophy prof. I have ever had!

I think this class is definitly doable.  You need to go to class in the second half because it does get more difficult.  The thing that made this class really hard is that the only grades were 3 exams.  Study a ton!  As long as you're willing to put time into studying you can get an A.

This class is very hard. Miller only gives three grades and they are tests. They are hard. Study guides may be helpful but too many vocab words to remember for a short test. Wouldn't recommend this class if you lose attention quickly.
This dude will blow your mind!
Michael is very clear when explaining the often obscure material. I wish I could take more classes with him, but I cannot.

Overall his teaching is rather "meh." There were some good moments, but far and few between. The class was inconsistent, dull, and unnecessarily didactic, which showed in the poor attendance. As a former teacher, I can say Daniel Wilkenfeld needs more development in dealing larger class dynamics.
Daniel is awesome but this class had way to much writing for me. but thats ok because he is hot.
I do not like Daniel's teaching style. He's hard to follow. He is nice, and he will answer your questions, but I would not recommend him if you are interested in taking Philosophy 1100.
What a great teacher. He will go far out of his way to answer questions and is genuinely interested in his class. Goes off on tangents sometimes but I kind of like that.
Very good professor. Definitely recommend. Class involves mostly discussion. He really makes you think about your beliefs.

He's not the best at explaining things, he goes through the material very quickly and speaks very quickly.  He's very nice and helpful though and a fair if tough grader.  If you're looking for a good prof for 150, I'd recommend Alison Duncan-Kerr instead.

I highly recommend anyone everyone to avoid this teacher at all costs. He was by far the worst teacher I ever had! This was the first class I ever took where I learned absolutely nothing other than the very first day. If you like classes where you just sit there and hear you teacher pace and opine the whole time his class is for you.
will seriously indulge all of your purpose/meaning of life questions as well as personal ethical quandries: PRICELESS.

VERY interesting class. The discussions were compelling and involved. Wilkenfeld seems very intelligent and knowledgeable. Attendance is nearly mandatory because you must participate. My only complaint is that he grades very tough on the issue papers.
Daniel is awesome.

This class will kick your behind, but if you put in the effort and go to office hours, you'll come out a MUCH better writer and thinker. Attend lecture (she boosts grades for people who show up regularly) and meet with her before you write the papers. She is a TOUGH grader. There's a lot of reading, but you can skimp a bit if you attend class.

Political Philosophy with Prof. Svavarsdottir was pretty good. With whatever new topics were being discussed, there was always debate and any message on the topics were conveyed with clarity. The grade in the class consisted on two-four page essays and two exams. You need to read your book to understand thoroughly the arguments.

Not as bad as it seems. Tough for an intro course, but if you go to class/recitation she explains a lot and gives good examples. The only bad thing about this class were the other students who wouldn't shut up and let her explain!
Lectures are extremely dry and boring. They are based straight from the book. Doesn't explain material too well. The class is required for the major but find another professor to take it with.
Hard to understand her lectures, very long & dry.
Good Teacher, very helpful if you take advantage of office hours, lectures are boring, but attending them is very helpful, Don't think this class should be a intro course though!

I thought that she was an approachableand nice teacher.  The material in the class is quite dense, but you don't need to read if you pay attention in class.  However, that is much more difficult than it sounds because her lectures are very dry.  We had to write four 3-page papers, but the grading of them is completely unpredicable.

A very nice and enjoyable lady, who is willing to go out of her way to help students, but soothing persona makes class a bit boring.  Overall I learnt the material and would recommend her as a professor.

Okay, I did pull an A-, but I have no idea how! The materal is wayyy too hard for a 100-level class taken by mostly first-quarter freshmen.  She was out of town before both exams, so no help there. The material was hard, the lectures weren't much help, and the TA's were just as confused as us...don't recommend!

very hard to understand. but despite that and her long lectures and threat that the TA's grade hard... I somehow passed with a B even though I slept through all the lectures. You'll be learning, but not realizing it!
worst teacher EVER!!!  please for the love of god don't take it, even if you think you'll like philosophy -- take something else with someone else.  i have never been so bored!
so boring, such long lectures and it was just very very difficult material
